intro: Hypodiscus eximius, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, thick leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, ranging from white to pink and purple, and bloom in spring and summer. Hypodiscus eximius is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
